intro: Glossorhyncha subuliformis, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its simple, often milky sap. The plant typically grows as a low, spreading shrub with narrow, needle-like leaves. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the spurge family. Glossorhyncha subuliformis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
